@description.name: @description
@description.body: Static class that provides localized date information (like names of week days, AM/PM markers, start of week, etc.).

@param.name: @param
@param.body: locale {String} optional locale to be used

@param.name: @param
@param.body: locale {String} optional locale to be used

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
length {String} format of the day names.
       Possible values: "abbreviated", "narrow", "wide"
@param.description:
format of the day names.
       Possible values: "abbreviated", "narrow", "wide"

@param.name: @param
@param.body: locale {String} optional locale to be used

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
context {String} (default: "format") intended context.
       Possible values: "format", "stand-alone"

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
withFallback {Boolean?} if true, the previous parameter's other value is tried
 in order to find a localized name for the day
@param.description:
if true, the previous parameter's other value is tried
 in order to find a localized name for the day

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String[]} array of localized day names starting with sunday.
@return.description: array of localized day names starting with sunday.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Return localized name of a week day name

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
length {String} format of the day name.
       Possible values: "abbreviated", "narrow", "wide"
@param.description:
format of the day name.
       Possible values: "abbreviated", "narrow", "wide"

@param.name: @param
@param.body: day {Integer} day number. 0=sunday, 1=monday, ...

@param.name: @param
@param.body: locale {String} optional locale to be used

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
context {String} (default: "format") intended context.
       Possible values: "format", "stand-alone"

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
withFallback {Boolean?} if true, the previous parameter's other value is tried
 in order to find a localized name for the day
@param.description:
if true, the previous parameter's other value is tried
 in order to find a localized name for the day

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
length {String} format of the month names.
       Possible values: "abbreviated", "narrow", "wide"
@param.description:
format of the month names.
       Possible values: "abbreviated", "narrow", "wide"

@param.name: @param
@param.body: locale {String} optional locale to be used

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
context {String} (default: "format") intended context.
       Possible values: "format", "stand-alone"

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
withFallback {Boolean?} if true, the previous parameter's other value is tried
 in order to find a localized name for the month
@param.description:
if true, the previous parameter's other value is tried
 in order to find a localized name for the month

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String[]} array of localized month names starting with january.
@return.description: array of localized month names starting with january.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
length {String} format of the month names.
       Possible values: "abbreviated", "narrow", "wide"
@param.description:
format of the month names.
       Possible values: "abbreviated", "narrow", "wide"

@param.name: @param
@param.body: month {Integer} index of the month. 0=january, 1=february, ...

@param.name: @param
@param.body: locale {String} optional locale to be used

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
context {String} (default: "format") intended context.
       Possible values: "format", "stand-alone"

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
withFallback {Boolean?} if true, the previous parameter's other value is tried
 in order to find a localized name for the month
@param.description:
if true, the previous parameter's other value is tried
 in order to find a localized name for the month

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Return localized date format string to be used with {@link qx.util.format.DateFormat}.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
size {String} format of the date format.
      Possible values: "short", "medium", "long", "full"
@param.description:
format of the date format.
      Possible values: "short", "medium", "long", "full"

@param.name: @param
@param.body: locale {String?} optional locale to be used

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Try to localize a date/time format string. For format string possibilities see Date/Time Symbol reference at CLDR - Unicode Common Locale Data Repository. If no localization is available take the fallback format string.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
canonical {String} format string containing only field information, and in a canonical order.
       Examples are "yyyyMMMM" for year + full month, or "MMMd" for abbreviated month + day.
@param.description:
format string containing only field information, and in a canonical order.
       Examples are "yyyyMMMM" for year + full month, or "MMMd" for abbreviated month + day.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: fallback {String} fallback format string if no localized version is found
@param.description: fallback format string if no localized version is found

@param.name: @param
@param.body: locale {String} optional locale to be used

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Return localized time format string to be used with {@link qx.util.format.DateFormat}.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
size {String} format of the time pattern.
      Possible values: "short", "medium", "long", "full"
@param.description:
format of the time pattern.
      Possible values: "short", "medium", "long", "full"

@param.name: @param
@param.body: locale {String} optional locale to be used

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Return the day the week starts with Reference: Common Locale Data Repository (cldr) supplementalData.xml

@param.name: @param
@param.body: locale {String} optional locale to be used

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Integer} index of the first day of the week. 0=sunday, 1=monday, ...
@return.description: index of the first day of the week. 0=sunday, 1=monday, ...

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Return the day the weekend starts with Reference: Common Locale Data Repository (cldr) supplementalData.xml

@param.name: @param
@param.body: locale {String} optional locale to be used

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Integer} index of the first day of the weekend. 0=sunday, 1=monday, ...
@return.description: index of the first day of the weekend. 0=sunday, 1=monday, ...

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Return the day the weekend ends with Reference: Common Locale Data Repository (cldr) supplementalData.xml

@param.name: @param
@param.body: locale {String} optional locale to be used

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Integer} index of the last day of the weekend. 0=sunday, 1=monday, ...
@return.description: index of the last day of the weekend. 0=sunday, 1=monday, ...

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns whether a certain day of week belongs to the week end.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: day {Integer} index of the day. 0=sunday, 1=monday, ...

@param.name: @param
@param.body: locale {String} optional locale to be used

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} whether the given day is a weekend day
@return.description: whether the given day is a weekend day

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Extract the territory part from a locale

@param.name: @param
@param.body: locale {String} the locale

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Provide localization (CLDR) data with fallback between "format" and "stand-alone" contexts. It is used in {@link #getDayName} and {@link #getMonthName} methods.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
context {String} intended context.
       Possible values: "format", "stand-alone".

@param.name: @param
@param.body: fallbackContext {String} the context used in case no localization is found for the key.
@param.description: the context used in case no localization is found for the key.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: key {String} message id (may contain format strings)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: locale {String} the locale
